Arrangement.text:
Verse 1: K[D]ing of my life I c[G/D]rown Thee n[D]ow T[D]hine shall the glory [A]be L[D]est I forget Thy th[G]orn-crowned b[D]row L[D]ead me to [D/A]Cal - [A]va - [D]ry
Chorus: L[A]est I forg[A7]et Geths[D]emane L[A]est I forg[A7]et Thine [D]agony L[Bm]est I for[F#7]get Thy l[G]ove for [D]me L[D]ead me to [D/A]Cal - [A]va - [D]ry
Verse 2: S[D]how me the tomb where T[G/D]hou wast l[D]aid T[D]enderly mourned and w[A]ept A[D]ngels in robes of l[G]ight arr[D]ayed G[D]uarded Thee w[D/A]hilst T[A]hou sl[D]ept
Verse 4: M[D]ay I be willing [G/D]Lord to b[D]ear D[D]aily my cross for T[A]hee E[D]ven Thy cup of g[G]rief to s[D]hare T[D]hou hast borne [D/A]all [A]for [D]me
Arrangement.searchtext: verse 1 king of my life i crown thee now thine shall the glory be lest i forget thy thorncrowned brow lead me to cal va ry chorus lest i forget gethsemane lest i forget thine agony lest i forget thy love for me lead me to cal va ry verse 2 show me the tomb where thou wast laid tenderly mourned and wept angels in robes of light arrayed guarded thee whilst thou slept verse 4 may i be willing lord to bear daily my cross for thee even thy cup of grief to share thou hast borne all for me
